message: Nice to haves: dual monitors, high DPI mouse. Use your brain! Don't design for actions, design for motivations. For example you don't design a skateboarding site based on looking at skateboards. You look at the people, the clothes they wear, the music their into, etc. See what -motivates- people. Most important thing.
What tools do I have to use. Photoshop??
Dafont, Colourlovers, basic knowledge of HTML etc if you're going to be designing for web. Helps to know your limitations
they're* - it's okay, I am slapping myself. Grammer nazi-ing myself.
Thanks dude. I wanna design for web and mobile.
You should probably check out design patterns too. Keep it simple & copy stuff at first, you'll soon learn what works and what doesn't
Feel free to DM if you've got any specific questions

Wanna get serious? Loose 6 months doing photoshop, illustrator and html + css tutorials and then decide if this is the path you like. If it is, get a nice iMac and good luck :)
Any advice on where to find some good tutorials??
http://tutsplus.com/ is great. I agree with h1brd too - learn Illustrator too.
